item.title: Pamela add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The only way to have a friend is to be one." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Lisa Unger
item.description: "The universe conspires to reveal the truth and to make your path easy if you have the courage to follow the signs." -- Lisa Unger

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Augustine Birrell
item.description: "An ordinary man can surround himself with two thousand books and thenceforward have at least one place in the world in which it is always possible to be happy." -- Augustine Birrell

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Augustine Birrell
item.description: "Good as it is to inherit a library, it is better to collect one." -- Augustine Birrell

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Augustine Birrell
item.description: "Libraries are not made; they grow." -- Augustine Birrell

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Nothing you do for children is ever wasted." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "You get old and you realize there are no answers, just stories." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Edmund White
item.description: "The most important things in our intimate lives can't be discussed with strangers, except in books." -- Edmund White

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Pamela add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Pamela add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Pamela add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "Nescire autem quid antequam natus sis acciderit, id est semper esse puerum. (To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.)" -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pamela add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "The meaning of life is that it stops." -- Franz Kafka
